intro: Dentaria digitata, commonly known as the starry toothcup, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five pointed petals that resemble a star. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Dentaria digitata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
